justification: "…we can interpret an individual's parameter estimates as measures of their speed of processing decision-relevant information (i.e., their drift rate)…"
The text states that parameter estimates capture "their caution (i.e., their criterion parameter)…"
The same sentence notes "their internal noise in the decision-making process (i.e., their diffusion coefficient)…"
construct: internal noise in the decision-making process

measured_by: proportional start point parameter (Diffusion Decision Model)
justification: The authors add that parameters reflect "their initial bias for a choice (i.e. their proportional start point parameter)…"
The introductory description includes "their speed of non-decision processes (i.e., the non-decision time)."
Later the paper explains that "SNR and CNR are still useful psychological constructs that reflect the person's decision ability and their speed-accuracy tradeoff, respectively…"
The same passage notes that CNR "reflect[s] the person's … speed-accuracy tradeoff."
